Apple___Apple_scab: Rake and destroy fallen leaves, prune for airflow, and plant resistant cultivars where possible.
Apple___Black_rot: Prune and remove infected tissue, destroy mummified fruit, and improve vine sanitation.
Apple___Cedar_apple_rust: Remove nearby junipers if practical, prune infected tissue, and use resistant varieties if available.
Apple___healthy: No action needed. Maintain good cultural practices: proper watering, balanced nutrition, and regular monitoring.
Blueberry___healthy: No action needed. Maintain good cultural practices: proper watering, balanced nutrition, and regular monitoring.
Cherry_(including_sour)___Powdery_mildew: Improve airflow and light, remove infected leaves, and use sulfur or horticultural oils if needed.
Cherry_(including_sour)___healthy: No action needed. Maintain good cultural practices: proper watering, balanced nutrition, and regular monitoring.
Corn_(maize)___Cercospora_leaf_spot Gray: Practice crop rotation, remove crop residue, and use resistant hybrids where possible.
Corn_(maize)___Common_rust_: Plant resistant hybrids, manage residue, and monitor regularly during warm, humid weather.
Corn_(maize)___Northern_Leaf_Blight: Use crop rotation, avoid continuous maize, and remove residue to reduce inoculum.
Corn_(maize)___healthy: No action needed. Maintain good cultural practices: proper watering, balanced nutrition, and regular monitoring.
Grape___Black_rot: Prune and remove infected tissue, destroy mummified fruit, and improve vine sanitation.
Grape___Esca_(Black_Measles): Prune and remove infected tissue, destroy mummified fruit, and improve vine sanitation.
Grape___Leaf_blight_(Isariopsis_Leaf_Spo: Prune and remove infected tissue, destroy mummified fruit, and improve vine sanitation.
Grape___healthy: No action needed. Maintain good cultural practices: proper watering, balanced nutrition, and regular monitoring.
Orange___Haunglongbing_(Citrus_greening): No cure — remove infected trees, control the Asian citrus psyllid vector, and plant certified disease-free stock.
Peach___Bacterial_spot: Remove infected plant parts, avoid overhead irrigation, and use copper bactericides only if necessary.
Peach___healthy: No action needed. Maintain good cultural practices: proper watering, balanced nutrition, and regular monitoring.
Pepper,_bell___Bacterial_spot: Remove infected plant parts, avoid overhead irrigation, and use copper bactericides only if necessary.
Pepper,_bell___healthy: No action needed. Maintain good cultural practices: proper watering, balanced nutrition, and regular monitoring.
Potato___Early_blight: Remove lower infected leaves, mulch to prevent soil splash, and rotate crops.
Potato___Late_blight: Destroy infected plants, avoid moving foliage, and improve drainage; consult extension for options.
Potato___healthy: No action needed. Maintain good cultural practices: proper watering, balanced nutrition, and regular monitoring.
Raspberry___healthy: No action needed. Maintain good cultural practices: proper watering, balanced nutrition, and regular monitoring.
Soybean___healthy: No action needed. Maintain good cultural practices: proper watering, balanced nutrition, and regular monitoring.
Squash___Powdery_mildew: Improve airflow and light, remove infected leaves, and use sulfur or horticultural oils if needed.
Strawberry___Leaf_scorch: Remove affected tissue, improve irrigation practices, and manage soil nutrition and drainage.
Strawberry___healthy: No action needed. Maintain good cultural practices: proper watering, balanced nutrition, and regular monitoring.
Tomato___Bacterial_spot: Remove infected plant parts, avoid overhead irrigation, and use copper bactericides only if necessary.
Tomato___Early_blight: Remove lower infected leaves, mulch to prevent soil splash, and rotate crops.
Tomato___Late_blight: Destroy infected plants, avoid moving foliage, and improve drainage; consult extension for options.
Tomato___Leaf_Mold: Improve airflow and reduce humidity, remove affected leaves, and practice good sanitation.
Tomato___Septoria_leaf_spot: Remove infected foliage, rotate crops, and avoid overhead irrigation.
Tomato___Spider_mites Two-spotted_spider: Increase humidity, spray plants with water to knock off mites, and encourage predatory mites.
Tomato___Target_Spot: Remove affected tissue, avoid overhead watering, and practice crop rotation.
Tomato___Tomato_Yellow_Leaf_Curl_Virus: No cure—remove infected plants, control whitefly vectors, and use resistant varieties.
Tomato___Tomato_mosaic_virus: Remove infected plants, disinfect tools, control aphid vectors, and use resistant varieties.
Tomato___healthy: No action needed. Maintain good cultural practices: proper watering, balanced nutrition, and regular monitoring.
